natural solution: Since $k$ is odd, $f(k) = k + 3.$  Then $k + 3$ is even, so \[f(k + 3) = \frac{k + 3}{2}.\]If $\frac{k + 3}{2}$ is odd, then \[f \left( \frac{k + 3}{2} \right) = \frac{k + 3}{2} + 3 = 27.\]This leads to $k = 45.$  But $f(f(f(45))) = f(f(48)) = f(24) = 12,$ so $\frac{k + 3}{2}$ must be even.
Then \[f \left( \frac{k + 3}{2} \right) = \frac{k + 3}{4} = 27.\]This leads to $k = 105.$  Checking, we find $f(f(f(105))) = f(f(108)) = f(54) = 27.$
